user_message:
An agent A claimed that the following MHD_set_panic_func code violates the MISRA C 2023 rule 1.2.
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<target_code>
Here is the original code of MHD_set_panic_func.
```c
_MHD_EXTERN void
MHD_set_panic_func (MHD_PanicCallback cb,
                    void *cls)
{
  if ((MHD_PanicCallback) NULL != cb)
    mhd_panic = cb;
  else
    mhd_panic = &mhd_panic_std;

  mhd_panic_cls = cls;
}
```
</target_code>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- explanation: your evaluation of the scenario provided by the agent A.
- is_report_correct: whether the report is correct or not (true/false). True means there is a violation.
</response format>
<scenario>
The agent A provided the following violation scenario:
The macro _MHD_EXTERN expands to __attribute__((visibility("default")))extern which uses GCC/Clang’s __attribute__((...)) syntax (the visibility attribute). __attribute__ is a compiler-specific language extension (documented as an extension), so this use violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
</scenario>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function MHD_set_panic_func:
#define _MHD_EXTERN __attribute__((visibility("default")))extern
...
typedef void
(*MHD_PanicCallback) (void *cls,
                      const char *file,
                      unsigned int line,
                      const char *reason)
...
MHD_PanicCallback mhd_panic = (MHD_PanicCallback) NULL
...
_MHD_NORETURN static void
mhd_panic_std (void *cls,
               const char *file,
               unsigned int line,
               const char *reason)
{
  (void) cls; /* Mute compiler warning. */
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
  fprintf (stderr,
           _ ("Fatal error in GNU libmicrohttpd %s:%u: %s\n"),
           file,
           line,
           reason);
#else  /* ! HAVE_MESSAGES */
  (void) file;   /* Mute compiler warning. */
  (void) line;   /* Mute compiler warning. */
  (void) reason; /* Mute compiler warning. */
#endif
  abort ();
}
...
void *mhd_panic_cls = NULL
</additional code>

<instruction>
Judge whether the report is correct or not.
</instruction>
explanation: The report is correct. The _MHD_EXTERN macro expands to __attribute__((visibility("default"))) extern, which uses GCC/Clang’s __attribute__ syntax (and the visibility attribute) — a compiler-specific language extension. MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 forbids use of language extensions unless explicitly accepted as a deviation; therefore the code as shown violates Rule 1.2. (Note: the same applies to other attribute-based macros such as _MHD_NORETURN if they resolve to compiler-specific attributes.)
